events.originalText: Unknown perpetrators carried out a series of four bombings in Dnipropetrovsk, Ukraine.
events.subtitle: 2012 Dnipropetrovsk explosions
events.headline: Series of Bombings in Dnipropetrovsk, Ukraine

events.originalText: The Airbus A380, the world's largest passenger airliner, made its maiden flight from Toulouse, France.
events.subtitle: Airbus A380
events.headline: Airbus A380 Maiden Flight from Toulouse, France

events.originalText: The black-ball final, one of the most famous snooker matches in history, began between Steve Davis and Dennis Taylor (pictured).
events.subtitle: 1985 World Snooker Championship final
events.headline: Steve Davis vs. Dennis Taylor in Black-Ball Final

events.originalText: The Expo 67 world's fair opened in Montreal, with 62 nations participating and more than 50 million visitors ultimately attending.
events.subtitle: Expo 67
events.headline: Expo 67 World's Fair Opens in Montreal

events.originalText: Indonesia–Malaysia confrontation: British forces repelled a surprise Indonesian attack on a base at Plaman Mapu in Sarawak.
events.subtitle: Indonesia–Malaysia confrontation
events.headline: British Forces Repel Indonesian Attack in Sarawak

events.originalText: Prime Minister Milton Margai led the Sierra Leone Colony and Protectorate to independence from the United Kingdom.
events.subtitle: Milton Margai
events.headline: Sierra Leone Colony and Protectorate Gains Independence

events.originalText: In response to the treatment of Lorenzo Gamboa under the White Australia policy, the Philippine House of Representatives passed a bill banning Australians from the country.
events.subtitle: Lorenzo Gamboa
events.headline: Philippine House Bans Australians in Response to White Australia Policy

events.originalText: World War II: The photograph Raising the Flag on the Three-Country Cairn (pictured) was taken after German troops withdrew to Norway at the end of the Lapland War.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Raising the Flag on the Three-Country Cairn After Lapland War

events.originalText: Chris Watson became the first prime minister of Australia from the Australian Labor Party.
events.subtitle: Chris Watson
events.headline: Chris Watson First Australian Labor Party Prime Minister

events.originalText: Ludwig van Beethoven composed his Bagatelle No. 25 in A minor, better known as "Für Elise", one of his most popular compositions.
events.subtitle: Ludwig van Beethoven
events.headline: Beethoven Composes 'Für Elise'

events.originalText: American Revolutionary War: British Army regulars defeated Patriot militias in the Battle of Ridgefield, galvanizing resistance in the Connecticut Colony.
events.subtitle: American Revolutionary War
events.headline: British Army Defeats Patriot Militias in Battle of Ridgefield

events.originalText: Wars of the Three Kingdoms: Covenanter forces defeated the Royalists at the Battle of Carbisdale near the village of Culrain, Scotland.
events.subtitle: Wars of the Three Kingdoms
events.headline: Covenanter Forces Triumph at Battle of Carbisdale in Scotland

events.originalText: Four Years' War: The combined forces of Spain and the Papal States defeated a French and Venetian army at the Battle of Bicocca.
events.subtitle: Italian War of 1521–1526
events.headline: Spain and Papal States Victorious at Battle of Bicocca

events.originalText: Filipino natives led by chieftain Lapulapu killed Portuguese explorer Ferdinand Magellan at the Battle of Mactan.
events.subtitle: Lapulapu
events.headline: Filipino Natives Kill Ferdinand Magellan at Battle of Mactan

events.originalText: Shahrbaraz usurped the throne of the Sasanian Empire from Ardashir III, but was himself killed six weeks later.
events.subtitle: Shahrbaraz
events.headline: Shahrbaraz Usurps Sasanian Empire Throne

events.originalText: Aelia Eudoxia married Byzantine emperor Arcadius without the knowledge or consent of Rufinus, the Praetorian prefect who had intended for his own daughter to wed the emperor.
events.subtitle: Aelia Eudoxia
events.headline: Aelia Eudoxia Marries Emperor Arcadius Against Rufinus' Wishes
